sections.title: On the full monomial automorphism groups of Reed--Solomon codes and their MDS-extensions
sections.abstract: We determine the full monomial automorphism groups of Reed--Solomon codes  and of their MDS-extensions by adding one, two, and three symbols. We show that several  Reed--Solomon codes, extended by two symbols, are equivalent to constacyclic codes and, under certain conditions, to cyclic codes.
sections.author: V.\,Kugurakov, A.\,Gainutdinova
sections.shorttit: Full monomial automorphism groups of RS-codes
sections.keywords: Error correction codes, Reed--Solomon codes, automorphisms of codes
main_part:
Besides monomial automorphisms, the code $V \subseteq{\mathbb F}^n_q$ can possess other automorphisms. Bijection $f:V \rightarrow V,$  satisfying a property 
\[d(v,w)= d(f(v), f(w)), \forall v,w \in V,\]
where $d(v,w)$ is a Hamming distance (or another distance) between vectors $v$ and $w$, is called isometry (or automorphism preserving distance). The set of all isometries of a code forms a group. Monomial transformations are a particular case of isometries. An another example of isometries is a shifts of code vectors of a linear code $V$: $v \mapsto v+w, \forall v\in V,$
where $w\in V$ is an arbitrary fixed vector. 
An open  problem is how to calculate  efficiently a full group of isometries of some code. This also relates  to RS-codes.
